      private static <V> void shortestPath​(AdjacencyMatrixGraph<V,​java.lang.Double> graph, int sourceIdx, boolean[] knownVertices, int[] verticesIndex, double[] minDist)
      Determine the shortest path to all vertices from a vertex using Dijkstra's algorithm To be called by public short method
      Parameters:
      graph - Graph object
      sourceIdx - Source vertex
      knownVertices - previously discovered vertices
      verticesIndex - index of vertices in the minimum path
      minDist - minimum distances in the path

    • shortestPath

      public static <V> double shortestPath​(AdjacencyMatrixGraph<V,​java.lang.Double> graph, V source, V dest, java.util.LinkedList<V> path)
      Determine the shortest path between two vertices using Dijkstra's algorithm
      Parameters:
      graph - Graph object
      source - Source vertex
      dest - Destination vertices
      path - Returns the vertices in the path (empty if no path)
      Returns:
      minimum distance, -1 if vertices not in model.graph or no path

      Recreates the minimum path between two vertex, from the result of Dikstra's algorithm
      Parameters:
      graph - Graph object
      sourceIdx - Source vertex
      destIdx - Destination vertices
      verticesIndex - index of vertices in the minimum path
      path - Vertices in the path (empty if no path)
